name: Federal National Mortgage Association
summary: The Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) is a U.S. government-sponsored enterprise and leading source of mortgage financing, providing liquidity to the housing market by purchasing and securitizing mortgage loans. Founded in 1938, Fannie Mae operates in the secondary mortgage market, supporting homeownership and affordable housing in the United States. It is one of the largest financial services companies in the country and is publicly traded under the ticker FNMA.
